author: Special Correspondent
text:
The outdoor park will house 34 models of life species

The all-weather models of life species at the Evolution Park at Anna Science Centre - Planetarium in Tiruchi.— PHOTO: B. VELANKANNI RAJ

Visitors to Anna Science Centre – Planetarium here will soon have an informative models on the evolution of life over the ages, providing visual treat and ensuring scientific approach in understanding and appreciating the evolution of different species.

Thirty four models of life species — ranging from Dinosaurs to scorpion and from unicellular to trilobite will be exhibited at the outdoor park.

“Rain or shine, the models can withstand any climatic condition as they are made of fibre,” said I.K. Lenin Tamilkovan, Project Director (in-charge) of Anna Science Centre.

The work which was taken up about a month ago at an estimate of Rs. 70 lakh, would be completed in a month’s time, he said.

With a view to attracting the visitors, the models would be illuminated for which special electrical circuits were being set up.

The models would be kept in kerb walls so that the visitors did not meddle with the models.

A pathway was being built to facilitate the devotees.
title: ‘Evolution Park’ coming up at Anna Science Centre
